verbs.description: attitudinize (third-person singular simple present attitudinizes, present participle attitudinizing, simple past and past participle attitudinized)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To assume an affected, unnatural exaggerated attitude or pose.
examples: Charlotte, who has the best voice, was brought out to sing, but was placed a little behind, as her person is not quite perfect; Maria, who is the most picturesque figure, was put to attitudinise at the harp  […]

entries.meaning: (transitive) To cause to assume a pose.
examples: In Greenwich, there were many gravelled walks, unshrubbed except for the nurses who dotted them, silent and attitudinized as trees.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give the appearance of, make a show of by posing.
examples: Radet was a cadaverous, weather-worn, passion-worn individual, badger-grey, and worked up into a grotesquely attitudinised fury of injured self-esteem
